text:
RT @ABCNewsLive Sen. Ted Cruz placed himself into voluntary self-quarantine after he interacted briefly with a person who is infected by the novel coronavirus.

"I'm feeling terrific, I have no symptoms, I'm in good health," @SenTedCruz says on @ABCNewsLive. https://trib.al/i9qp7bX http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETBsYXuXgAIxEAO.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238606163979259907/vid/480x270/vJDlUFjuC7ebpeBb.mp4?tag=13

RT @CBSThisMorning NEW: @SenTedCruz has extended his self-quarantine after he learned he interacted with a Spanish government official who tested positive with #coronavirus. “I remain strong, healthy and have no symptoms.”

Sen. Cruz explains to @CBSThisMorning via phone. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ES_ZJqdXgAANoUk.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238446375072915457/vid/480x270/_dmU2Ge-68Rjz5rF.mp4?tag=13

For families’ economic security, #FamiliesFirst secures paid emergency leave with two weeks of paid sick leave and up to three months of paid family and medical leave. We have also secured enhanced Unemployment insurance for those who lose their jobs.

I remember when I was 12 & my daddy had a heart attack. He couldn’t work for a long time. The bills piled up, we lost the family station wagon, & we were about an inch away from losing our home. We nearly went over the financial cliff, but we made it – just barely.
Senator Marco Rubio released the following statement after @POTUS declared a national emergency in response to the coronavirus: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETA2nbcX0AAOs9V.jpg

Short-term: we must provide emergency unemployment assistance and include workers who depend on tips, gig workers, domestic workers and independent contractors.

Long-term: we need Medicare for All so your health insurance is not tied to your job. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1237821091680313344 QT @washingtonpost The first U.S. layoffs from the coronavirus are here.

Job losses have begun in ports, bakeries and travel agencies. Economists worry more layoffs are coming in the next few weeks as many businesses see plummeting sales. https://trib.al/3i7xQ6Q

👀WATCH👀
#Coronavirus: What You Need to Know

⚕️How it spreads
⚕️Symptoms
⚕️Prevention
⚕️What to do if you're sick

Visit @CDCgov for more information. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1238479985037455362/pu/img/DOsBjdFaj9Av6vvx.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1238479985037455362/pu/vid/320x320/KyGa9YHTg78y-hOk.mp4?tag=10

This is absurd propaganda from the Chinese communist government, whose repeated attempts to keep the outbreak secret contributed significantly to the Wuhan virus becoming a worldwide pandemic. https://news.trust.org/item/20200312152307-rlv7m

Sen. Rubio, @SenTomCotton, & @SenTedCruz sent a letter to @POTUS urging his administration take all appropriate action to protect U.S. service members from @ICC prosecution following the recent misguided decision to authorize an investigation into U.S. involvement in Afghanistan.

From food security to paid family leave, the bipartisan #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act, which we vote on tonight, is focused on delivering support to families across America as we confront this public health crisis. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETCX03QXQAEDqrQ.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238656167343263744/vid/480x270/lkQXccsa3vAqwVHr.mp4?tag=13

The outbreak of #COVID19 highlights our reliance on foreign-manufactured pharmaceuticals and the risk it poses to our national security. We need a strategy to safeguard our medical supply chain, preventing a sole reliance on China for critical supplies. https://www.romney.senate.gov/romney-helps-introduce-bill-address-medical-supply-vulnerability-due-coronavirus

We can help people stay home if they're sick and support our economy by:
-Creating an emergency paid leave program
-Increasing Social Security checks by $200 per month
-Expanding unemployment benefits
-Canceling student loan debt
https://elizabethwarren.com/plans/updated-plan-address-coronavirus?source=soc-WB-ew-tw

.@RepKatiePorter got the Director of the CDC to commit to free coronavirus testing for every American. This is so important and will save lives. The CDC must follow through on this immediately. https://twitter.com/RepKatiePorter/status/1238147835859779584 QT @RepKatiePorter I did the math: a full battery of coronavirus testing costs at minimum $1,331.

I also did the legal research: the Administration has the authority to make testing free for every American TODAY.

I secured a commitment from a high-level Trump official that they’d actually do it. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238146316359925760/img/fRNZ8kZYOl1EQCrR.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238146316359925760/vid/366x270/xAKKX55qiRsKgTw3.mp4?tag=13

This incompetent administration’s response to the coronavirus has threatened the lives and health of many people.

Congress must immediately ensure that everyone who needs coronavirus testing and treatment gets it without ever having to open their wallet.

For families’ food security, #FamiliesFirst strengthens nutrition security initiatives such as SNAP, student meals, seniors’ nutrition & food banks. 22 million children rely on free or reduced-price school meals for their food security; we must ensure that they have food to eat.

RT @RepAndyLevin #Coronavirus requires a WWII-scale effort to produce supplies, like protective equipment for health care workers, on a massive scale. 56 colleagues and I called on the President to invoke the Defense Production Act to produce what we need to protect Americans now. We can't wait. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETB8_c0XsAA8U7K.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETB9AxiWsAE7sRo.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETB9BXLX0AI1zz1.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETB9CWUX0AI1OxY.png

On the election end, @repblumenauer & @RepDonBeyer are pressing state governments to come up with plans for election continuity to account for coronavirus.

(In 2018, 58% (!) of poll workers were over 60. We have to protect them too.)

https://twitter.com/repblumenauer/status/1238534712840183811?s=21 https://twitter.com/repblumenauer/status/1238534712840183811 QT @repblumenauer @AOC While taking care of people comes first, we must also protect our democracy. @RepRaskin, @RepDelBene, and I are working to ensure our elections continue and allow everyone to vote at home if needed. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETAooTzU4AIsUcD.png

For families’ health security, #FamiliesFirst increases federal funds for Medicaid to support our local, state, tribal and territorial governments and health systems, so that they have the resources necessary to combat this crisis.

RT @RepMcGovern NEWS: Today I helped lead the Massachusetts Congressional Delegation in demanding that the @USDA & @SecretarySonny immediately halt SNAP eligibility changes to protect vulnerable families in light of #COVID19. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETA6ntGWAAMtl0V.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETA6oXPX0AAxXqU.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETA6o_tXsAEYRIE.jpg

RT @chiproytx A civic path to #BeatCoronaVirus 

Remember these 5 S's:

1️⃣ Separate: as much as possible

2️⃣ Sanitize: Soap & Water

3️⃣ Sleep

4️⃣ Seek Medical Advice on Phone (Spare resources)

5️⃣ Serve Seniors to protect them

#ProtectOurSeniors 👉 https://chiproy.com/protect-our-seniors/

All seniors, especially those like me who are over 70, must take every precaution: we are the ones most likely to suffer the most severe complications from COVID-19 that will overwhelm the healthcare system. Please, follow strict social-distancing & even consider self-quarantine.

The last thing struggling workers should have to worry about during the coronavirus outbreak is falling behind on their rent or mortgage & losing their home. @SenJeffMerkley & I are calling for a national moratorium on evictions & foreclosures. https://www.merkley.senate.gov/news/press-releases/merkley-warren-push-trump-administration-to-protect-americans-from-evictions-foreclosures-amid-ongoing-coronavirus-pandemic-2020 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETACms8X0AE77qr.png
I am delivering a statement about the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act live from the U.S. Capitol. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1BRJjQjlMooGw

RT @katephillips California's governor said the state received test kits for coronavirus from the federal government that did not include all the components needed to actually run a test. https://www.huffpost.com/entry/california-coronavirus-testing_n_5e6a957dc5b6bd8156f3d84b?ncid=engmodushpmg00000004 # via @HuffPostPol
RT @JoelMartinRubin #JewsForBernie Virtual Phonebanks: "Call Your Bubbe in Florida"! https://actionnetwork.org/forms/jewsforbernie-virtual-phonebanks-call-your-bubbe-in-florida

RT @newtgingrich We do not need a ‘stimulus” package or a “recovery” package. We need an economic growth package that stimulates and invests in the kind of development that grows a bigger, better, more productive and more competitive American economy for the future.

When Trump tells people to "listen to their doctors," we must not forget: 1 out of every 4 Americans do not have a primary care physician.

In the midst of this crisis, we must provide everyone—regardless of income—with all of the health care they need without cost.

RT @laurenblair88 TUNE IN: @SenTedCruz is joining @dianermacedo on @ABCNewsLive @abcnews at 6:10pmCT to talk about the 4 concrete, immediate steps he's urging the admin to take to combat #COVID19 Watch here --> https://abcnews.go.com/live

This could lead to sick people going into work for fear of losing eligibility. An absolutely heartless move that must be reversed. 
https://twitter.com/pdmcleod/status/1238206430483746816 QT @pdmcleod The Trump Administration Will Move Ahead With Their Plan To Kick People Off Of Food Stamps Despite Coronavirus Outbreak

https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/paulmcleod/coronavirus-food-stamps-trump-administration http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ES799zrXQAc10KO.jpg

First up: as many of you saw yesterday, Katie Porter did a masterful job in Oversight to get the (hesitant) CDC to commit to FREE testing on Coronavirus ⬇️ https://twitter.com/repkatieporter/status/1238147835859779584?s=21 QT @RepKatiePorter I did the math: a full battery of coronavirus testing costs at minimum $1,331.

I also did the legal research: the Administration has the authority to make testing free for every American TODAY.

I secured a commitment from a high-level Trump official that they’d actually do it. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238146316359925760/img/fRNZ8kZYOl1EQCrR.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238146316359925760/vid/366x270/xAKKX55qiRsKgTw3.mp4?tag=13

The House is set to take up emergency legislation to address the coronavirus, including to provide paid sick leave and make testing free for all.

Mitch McConnell must cancel the weekend so the Senate can immediately vote on this bill. The American people need us to act.

RT @JoyAnnReid Good for @Yamiche for pushing back on Trump's "take no responsibility" statement by pointing out that Trump disbanded the NSC office that dealt with pandemics. Trump denies he disbanded the office at all. Calls it a "nasty" question and ignores her attempts to restate her Q.

@fred_guttenberg @JoeBiden I was discussing youth turnout.

Bernie’s campaign tried a strategy of blowing up youth turnout. It worked to an extent, but wasn’t enough to get us past the post. What I *was* discussing were the 3 hour waits at polling locations, which can sometimes deter young people.

#COVID19 is a serious public health crisis & we must take it seriously.

That doesn’t mean panic.

It means we be prudent, follow the science & listen to advice of medical professionals:

🧼 Wash hands regularly with soap & water

🏠Avoid large gatherings http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238471963221405701/img/rECnXbXX3KMb8N61.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238471963221405701/vid/480x270/XbgJJxbtuhi3tI7n.mp4?tag=13

Imagine having a government that fights for the needs of working people, not corporate profits, Wall Street, and fossil fuel companies.

That's the nation we can build together.

The Trump administration’s coronavirus response needs to quickly implement the advice of public health experts – not make politicized decisions based on the whims of the President. Enough is enough, @VP Pence. https://www.warren.senate.gov/oversight/letters/warren-colleagues-urge-pence-to-protect-federal-covid-19-response-from-political-interference

Rep. Tom @Malinowski has been working with insurance execs to confirm that people can fill prescriptions earlier than they usually are allowed to, so they can better stock + prepare:
https://twitter.com/malinowski/status/1238517888706842625?s=21 QT @Malinowski Just spoke to several insurance company execs. Confirmed industry is moving to allow early refills & encourage 90-day mail order supplies. Next steps: expand coverage for telemedicine, and action to prevent surprise bills when patients are forced to get treatment out of network. https://twitter.com/Malinowski/status/1237817861021806593

RT @sfpelosi #FridayMotivation: love ❤️ my twitter fam. We have spent years bonding, united by our values.  We take heart from our @TeamPelosi motto #DontAgonizeOrganize and from relationships we’ve built to make progress #forthepeople. We’ll take care of each other thru #COVID19 & beyond. 💙

RT @SenTedCruz #COVID19 is a serious public health crisis & we need to take it seriously. That doesn’t mean panic. It means we need to be prudent, follow the science, & listen to the advice of medical professionals:
🧼 Wash hands regularly with soap & water.
🏠Avoid going to large gatherings. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238471963221405701/img/rECnXbXX3KMb8N61.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238471963221405701/vid/480x270/XbgJJxbtuhi3tI7n.mp4?tag=13

I will put an end to the pride of the arrogant, the insolence of tyrants I will humble.

Isaiah 11:13

RT @AFJustice .@senatemajldr Mitch McConnell left DC yesterday without doing anything to address the #COVID19 crisis. 

No paid sick leave.  
No free testing.  
Nothing. 

Nothing for the millions of people impacted by the coronavirus.

El senador estadounidense Marco Rubio emitió el siguiente comunicado tras la declaración de emergencia nacional por parte de @POTUS en respuesta al coronavirus: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETA25jEWAAEN0sJ.jpg

As we fight the spread of #COVID19 we must remember we're only as healthy as our most vulnerable neighbors.

That's why we must pass @PattyMurray's bill to guarantee 7 days of sick leave for all workers & guarantee 14 days of paid sick leave during public health emergencies.

It couldn't be more imperative that we move quickly to  expand paid sick leave. This is essential not only to stop the spread of coronavirus, but for the economic well-being of millions of Americans. https://thehill.com/homenews/senate/487113-gop-chairman-blocks-quick-passage-of-paid-sick-leave-bill

RT @realDonaldTrump It is my great honor to declare Sunday, March 15th as a National Day of Prayer. We are a Country that, throughout our history, has looked to God for protection and strength in times like these....
#FamiliesFirst is about testing, testing, testing. To stop the spread of the virus, we have secured free #coronavirus testing for everyone who needs a test, including the uninsured.

@HHSgov just awarded $53.4 million in federal funding to health centers across #Florida. Our health centers are integral in caring for all patients, especially if our healthcare system becomes overwhelmed by the #coronavirus.

The @SenateGOP once again blocked @PattyMurray's bill providing emergency paid sick leave to workers so they can take time to get treated or care for loved ones & contain the coronavirus outbreak. This is outrageous. https://twitter.com/PattyMurray/status/1238254365850447872 QT @PattyMurray Once again, I went to the Senate floor to try to pass my emergency paid sick days legislation. And once again, Senate Republicans blocked it.
 
We have no time to waste—which is why I will keep fighting to get families and workers the protections they need. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238212642269016064/img/Gvtw29A0TKL8V7kD.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238212642269016064/vid/480x270/8PVvg6uBIfCH_oN0.mp4?tag=13

Previous administrations—both Republican and Democratic—have allowed states flexibility with Medicaid in times of crisis. There is simply no reason to deny this to states today in the middle of a pandemic. Disgraceful. https://www.latimes.com/politics/story/2020-03-13/trump-administration-blocks-states-use-medicaid-respond-coronavirus-crisis

Good.

Many other issues aside, I am thankful that @stevenmnuchin1 & the admin are taking pausing student loan payments seriously - it is a decisive move that will help stabilize millions of people.

We should do it now. There is much more to be done, but every step counts. https://twitter.com/andrewkeshner/status/1238541699456122882 QT @AndrewKeshner Steve Mnuchin says the Trump administration could consider pauses on student loan payments. People like @AOC say that must happen right now. https://www.marketwatch.com/story/student-loan-borrowers-could-get-a-temporary-break-on-payments-amid-coronavirus-financial-fallout-mnuchin-says-2020-03-13?mod=personal-finance

RT @AmeshAA I do think ⁦@tedcruz⁩’s idea regarding FDA reciprocity with other countries could be a crucial tool in pandemic preparedness, especially with the diagnostic devices we need  https://www.statnews.com/pharmalot/2020/03/12/cruz-coronavirus-fda-approvas/

#COVID19 is a serious public health crisis & we need to take it seriously. That doesn’t mean panic. It means we need to be prudent, follow the science, & listen to the advice of medical professionals:
🧼 Wash hands regularly with soap & water.
🏠Avoid going to large gatherings. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238471963221405701/img/rECnXbXX3KMb8N61.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238471963221405701/vid/480x270/XbgJJxbtuhi3tI7n.mp4?tag=13

RT @CAPAction We now know that Trump wanted LESS coronavirus testing to hide how fast the virus is spreading.

@RepAdamSchiff warned us:

“You know you can’t trust [Trump] to do what’s right for this country. You can trust he will do what’s right for [himself]."
http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1220550736175620097/pu/img/5BUxFfchoW2OGcjV.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1220550736175620097/pu/vid/480x270/YgCBEEwLLPPysvEv.mp4?tag=10
As the Senate works to pass #FamiliesFirst, the House will begin work on a third emergency response package to protect the health, economic security and well-being of the American people.

We’re in the middle of a public health crisis and it’s critical we all take it seriously. 

—Wash your hands with soap and water as often as you can. 
—Keep a safe social distance from people. 

If we’re going to slow down this virus, it’s going to take all of us doing our part.

One of the reasons I'm running for president is for my grandchildren and kids all over the world. We're going to create the nation and world that they deserve. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238102057363668993/img/JShNcOOqZNGUEq4L.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238102057363668993/vid/320x320/pG5kEAmzqkTl5oWf.mp4?tag=13

#COVID19 is not a Democratic virus or a Republican virus. It is a dangerous virus. This is a serious public health crisis, and we need to take it seriously. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1238494009250721793/pu/img/BPGXCnDukT3zCizj.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1238494009250721793/pu/vid/480x270/CEjae2DZAme9J0tU.mp4?tag=10

The business model of the pharmaceutical industry:

1. Use taxpayer-funded research
2. Get patent monopolies on treatment
3. Charge any price they want

This is a racket that is literally killing people, and it must end.

Now is not the time for profiteering or price gouging. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBeOEIzU0AA6jDP.png https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1159550923686834177/vid/320x320/oQ-WzxJ-A3jjcT5Q.mp4?tag=13

Americans who lack paid sick days:
70% of the lowest income workers
81% of food service industry workers
75% of child care center workers

Access to health care for low income people & for people of color is already a public health crisis—the spread of #COVID19 is a disaster.

Amazon paid $0 in taxes on $11 billion in annual profits. But it asks workers to “donate” their paid leave to others who are sick.

Workers and taxpayers are expected to be generous. Corporate CEOs—even during a pandemic—can be as stingy as they want. https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/93988v/whole-foods-suggests-that-workers-share-paid-time-off-during-coronavirus
Reminder that just 2 days ago, Republican Senators blocked our bill to guarantee emergency paid sick leave to workers affected by the coronavirus.
https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?p=Press-Releases&id=FC8CA492-0B5B-4A17-A640-F6F2EDAA7D5F

@fred_guttenberg @JoeBiden I am looking forward to uniting behind the eventual nominee and defeating Trump. But in this moment we have to be extra mindful of the attempts and flashy headlines that try to get us to jump to conclusions. My DMs are open to you & if you have a Q again, feel free to reach out.
At 2 p.m. ET today I will deliver another address to the nation on the lessons our country can learn from the coronavirus outbreak. Please tune in at http://live.berniesanders.com.

As a caucus, Dems under @SpeakerPelosi’s leadership are currently trying to pass the #FamiliesFirst Act to set up paid leave, extend emergency unemployment, protect healthcare workers & more.

@RepDebHaaland has the update here ⬇️

https://twitter.com/repdebhaaland/status/1238257753363283970?s=21 https://twitter.com/repdebhaaland/status/1238257753363283970 QT @RepDebHaaland A quick update as we await the vote on a bill to put #FamiliesFirst including: 

🏥Establish FREE coronavirus tests
💵Strengthen unemployment benefits
🏠Provide paid leave
👩🏽‍⚕️Protect frontline health care workers http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1238256986296328194/pu/img/0L1gGpmHjIUy1kNA.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1238256986296328194/pu/vid/320x568/znyHcHgYxU1e-aBu.mp4?tag=10

None should have to choose between staying home while sick or being able to afford to feed their babies and keep a roof over their head. 

Yet two-thirds of low-income workers do not have paid sick leave.

Paid sick leave makes everyone safer. We must guarantee it now.

Exactly 3 years ago, I questioned @HHSgov & @CDCgov about their readiness for a flu pandemic. Key government positions were vacant, budgets were being slashed, & the President’s only idea was a travel ban. It’s been 3 years – & nothing has changed. https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/senate-and-house-leaders-raise-concerns-about-the-impact-of-president-trump-and-039s-decisions-on-hhs-and-cdc-preparedness-for-a-flu-pandemic

Good to see us starting to utilize the unique advantages the U.S. has over nations relying solely on a central govt response to #Covid_19
-Federalism with effective state & local govts
-private sector we can enlist to provide solutions quickly
-civil society & community action

There is a lot going wrong with the admin’s current response, but I also want to make to highlight some of the progress my House colleagues & I are making on Coronavirus response despite challenges.

(If you’re a House member & want your effort added just @ me!)

Thread ⬇️

RT @brianstelter Anonymous Fox producer: As the virus spreads, "the attempt to deflect and blame the media and Democrats from Trish Regan, Sean Hannity, Laura Ingraham, Lou Dobbs, Jesse Watters, and Greg Gutfeld... is really irresponsible and hazardous to our viewers" https://view.newsletters.cnn.com/messages/1584069038272bd0127023141/raw

RT @CBSThisMorning @SenTedCruz has extended his self-quarantine after he learned he interacted with a Spanish government official who tested positive with #coronavirus. “I remain strong, healthy and have no symptoms.” https://www.cbsnews.com/news/coronavirus-ted-cruz-republican-senator-extends-self-quarantine-after-second-interaction/?ftag=CNM-00-10aab8d&linkId=84280477

Today I released the following statement on my decision to extend my self-quarantine until March 17 out of an abundance of caution and to give everyone peace of mind: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ES_iBrzWoAAl_5e.jpg

President Trump is unable and unwilling to lead selflessly.

We must immediately convene an emergency, bipartisan authority of experts to support and direct a response that is comprehensive, compassionate, and based first and foremost on science and fact.

If the fed govt is serious about helping families now, the LEAST it could do is cancel – not suspend – monthly payments by paying down loans for borrowers each month during this crisis. Suspending payments or interest & then making borrowers just pay later won't help enough.

RT @AdamSchiff As @RepKatiePorter demonstrates, the CDC has the legal authority to allow every American to get free testing and treatment for coronavirus during a public health emergency.

We must ensure cost is no barrier to getting tested, protected and cared for. We’re all in this together. https://twitter.com/repkatieporter/status/1238147835859779584 QT @RepKatiePorter I did the math: a full battery of coronavirus testing costs at minimum $1,331.

I also did the legal research: the Administration has the authority to make testing free for every American TODAY.

I secured a commitment from a high-level Trump official that they’d actually do it. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238146316359925760/img/fRNZ8kZYOl1EQCrR.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238146316359925760/vid/366x270/xAKKX55qiRsKgTw3.mp4?tag=13

Over the last several weeks, our nation has been faced with a challenge that tests our compassion, ingenuity and resolve: the coronavirus crisis. Now, the House is focused on providing support for America’s families, who must be our first priority. #FamiliesFirst http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238598420492943361/img/9YCzAGz7nfeN-wyB.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238598420492943361/vid/480x270/9EJ3C_CsYh4oo_10.mp4?tag=13

These cancellations & closings are creating hardships. 

But it must happen & we must all do our part. 

It’s the only way to slow the #Covid_19 rate of infection & prevent a catastrophic shortage of ICU beds & life support ventilators. I wrote more here: https://medium.com/@SenatorMarcoRubio/getting-ahead-of-the-curve-how-we-can-slow-coronavirus-ea46252c8135

The coronavirus outbreak has been declared a national emergency and we all need to do our part to stop its spread. Follow the guidance from your state, local, and federal officials, and stay up-to-date with the latest information from @CDCgov here. 
https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-nCoV/index.html

There are 4 concrete steps we can take now to curb #COVID19 & defeat it:
1️⃣Make testing more accurate & available
2️⃣Ensure we have essential med supplies for first responders & healthcare professionals
3️⃣Create more capacity for hospitals
4️⃣Work quickly to find cures

Hola a todos, quería escribirles una 📝 como rendición de cuentas.

Normalmente no voy a FOX por cuestión de principios, pero la desinformación sobre el coronavirus me tiene preocupada sobre el riesgo.
Por favor recuerden porque es tan importante el que luchemos por el cuidado de salud como un derecho humano.

¿Quieren saber una de las mayores razones por la cual Corea del Sur ha tenido una respuesta estelar y ha producido rápidamente & llegado hasta más de 10mil pruebas/dia?

Tienen un sistema de #MedicareParaTodos con un solo pagador.

Nosotros no lo tenemos.
Tenemos que cuidar de la gente trabajadora tanto como cuidamos de la bolsa de valores.

Para su información, la cantidad que la Reserva Federal acaba de inyectar casi cubre toda la deuda estudiantil en los E.E.U.U.

No hay absolutamente NINGUNA excusa para no hacer pausa a la colección de la deuda estudiantil, planear para alivio con las hipotecas & las rentas, etc. https://twitter.com/AliVelshi/status/1238153956645363714
Por eso es imperativo que pasemos medidas de emergencia como cuidado de salud garantizado, licencia pagada, moratorias en la eviciones & más para proteger a las personas encargadas de la logística.

Podrían estar alrededor de gente inmunocomprometida y no saberlo.  Si mucha gente se enferma al mismo tiempo, podría abrumar los hospitales & los sistemas.

¡Asi que quedense en casa! 

Claro que como sabemos el quedarse en casa es más fácil decirlo que hacerlo.

En este momento la pregunta de distanciamiento social no es solo “¿me podría enfermar?”, es “¿podría sin saber pasarselo a otros?” https://twitter.com/joshjame/status/1238178077253001220 QT @joshjame .⁦@AOC⁩ doing a live Q&A on Instagram about the coronavirus. Says panic won’t do any good but people need to be clear-eyed about the threat.

“People are saying, ‘Oh, this isn’t going to hurt me,’” she says before making plain: “This is about 10x worse than the flu.” http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ES7kZZBXgAEggzs.jpg
Eso incluye cambios a las licencias pagadas, UBI, alivio de detención (antes del juicio, a las persona mayores, a los inmigrantes)

Este no es un momento para medidas a medias.

Tenemos que tomar acción dramática ahora para prevenir los peores efectos a la salud pública & la economía.

El gobierno federal debería considerar pausar la colección de deudas sobre los préstamos estudiantiles.

También deberíamos considerar medidas para alivio con los hipotecas.
